article:
The '1999â2000 Football League Cup' (known as the 'Worthington Cup' for
sponsorship reasons) was the 40th staging of the Football League Cup, a knockout
competition for England's top 92 football clubs. The competition name reflects a
sponsorship deal with lager brand Worthington.

The competition began on 10 August 1999, and ended with the final on 27 February
2000, the last final to be held at Wembley Stadium. For the first time in
English football history, the entire draw for each round was made after Round
1. [http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/1999/sep/26/newsstory.sport2 Explain
the Worthington Cup draw] - guardian.co.uk This meant each team could plot
their route to the final as well as predicting future opponents.

The tournament was won by Leicester City, who beat Tranmere Rovers 2â1 in the
final, thanks to two goals from Matt Elliott, sandwiched by an equaliser from
David Kelly.
